11.title: Signé Mister Foo
11.author: Felipe H
11.appears_in: Cava et Federico Del Barrio ; traduit de l'espagnol par Isabelle Thierry.
notes: (Les Mémoires d'Amoros ; v. 1)
(Collection Octave)
"Dessin de Federico Del Barrio et scénario de Felipe H. Cava."

"Dans le Madrid de la fin des années vingt, une série de meurtres frappent des immigrés 'chinois.' Tous signés de la main d'un mystérieux Mister Foo. Jeune journaliste au quotidien la Voz, Angel Amoros mène l'enquète. Il apparaît peu à peu que ces assassinats s'inscrivent dans un complot lié à la perte de la colonie philippine."

249.author: script, Gardner Fox ; art, Howard Sherman ; letters, Joe Letterese
notes: Summary: Riding through Saddle Rock, Wyoming is confused to find every business is named after him, since he has never been there before. He's told that the townspeople use his name as a deterrent to outlaws. But Wyoming notices that the signs are all freshly painted, and discovers it's a ruse to cover up the fact that outlaws already run the town and the townspeople are prisoners.

325.title: Sihi
325.author: script, Pushpa Bharati ; illustrations, P
325.appears_in: B. Kavadi ; editor, Anant Pai. p. 1-31 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 613 (1977, 2009 printing).
notes: (Visionaries)
Begins: "Soordas was born in 1478 A.D. to a poor Saraswat Brahman couple of Sihi village near Delhi."

Summary from back cover: "Just because the boy was blind, he became the butt of every unkind prank. Little did his family realise that Soordas could often see more than anyone else. He could direct a shepherd to his lost goat and a father to his missing son. He could describe exactly how the idol of his beloved Lord Krishna was dressed in the temple each day. The Mughal emperor Akbar personally came to invite him to his court. The poet, Tulsidas, visited him. The powerful, the wise and the ordinary flocked to him for his all-seeing wisdom and his soul-stirring songs of devotion."
Entered here as: Sûradâsa, 1483?-1563?
